articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: First person-to-person coronavirus case reported in U.S. as WHO declares global health emergency
articles.description: The CDC today confirmed a new case of coronavirus, the first one to be spread person-to-person in the United States. The unidentified Chicago man caught it from his wife after she returned from Wuhan, China.
A piece of the border wall falls, a surfer in front of Mount Fuji, a new hospital to treat coronavirus patients and more.
articles.content:
Firefighters work at the scene of the helicopter crash where Kobe Bryant, his daughter Gianna and seven others were killed in Calabasas, Calif., on Jan. 26, 2020.

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: New coronavirus outbreak declared global public health emergency
articles.description: WHO update: WHO coronavirus declared a public health emergency.  Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus convened a WHO emergency meeting Thursday.
articles.content:
The outbreak of the new coronavirus was declared a global public health emergency on Thursday by the World Health Organization.
While nearly 99 percent of the 7,874 diagnoses have been limited to China, other cases have been diagnosed in 18 other countries, … [+875 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: ‘The situation is under control’: Italian coast guard on stranded cruise passengers
articles.description: Health officials “requested the maritime authorities refuse the disembarkation of passengers” after a suspected case of coronavirus on board, said Vincenzo Leone of the Port of Civitavecchia.

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: Coronavirus spreads for first time in U.S., CDC says
articles.description: The CDC has announced the first person-to-person spread of coronavirus in the U.S. This is a close contact of the patient in Chicago.
articles.content:
A close contact of one of the patients in the U.S. with coronavirus has been infected with the illness, the first evidence that the new virus has spread person-to-person in this country, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Thursday.
The n… [+527 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus misinformation surges, fueled by a chase for attention
articles.description: Misleading, unverified and clearly false information about the coronavirus has spread across social media platforms, with some accounts only a few days old reaching millions of views with a mix of fearmongering and racial stereotyping.

articles.author: Phil McCausland
articles.title: Trump administration announces Medicaid program funding overhaul
articles.description: Named "Healthy Adult Opportunity," the new guidance would provide states the option to receive their federal Medicaid funding as a block grant, or lump sum.
articles.content: The Trump administration announced Thursday morning that it would take the largest step to overhaul Medicaid yet, providing an alternative to red states that want to limit spending on the public insurance option and take greater control of the health program.… [+7440 chars]

articles.title: Bloomberg unveils Super Bowl ad on gun violence
articles.description: Michael Bloomberg's Super Bowl ad touts his record on preventing gun violence, evoking the story of a mother whose son was killed at just 20 years old.
articles.content:
DES MOINES, Iowa Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's multimillion-dollar Super Bowl ad touts his record on preventing gun violence, evoking the story of a mother whose son was shot and killed at just 20 years old.

articles.title: Possible coronavirus case on cruise ship with 6,000 passengers docked in Italy
articles.description: The cruise ship with the Costa Crociere line has 6,000 passengers and is docked off Italian coast with one passenger showing possible symptoms of coronavirus.
articles.content:
ROME More than 100 Americans are on board a cruise ship that has a passenger showing symptoms of the coronavirus, officials said Thursday.

articles.title: Wilbur Ross suggests coronavirus will 'accelerate the return of jobs to North America'
articles.description: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross tells Fox Business that he thinks the coronavirus will "accelerate the return of jobs to North America."

articles.title: Senate Republicans appear ready to fall in line on impeachment vote despite earlier concerns
articles.description: First Read is your briefing from "Meet the Press" and the NBC Political Unit on the day's most important political stories and why they matter.
articles.content:

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Stocks of face masks run low across Asia amid fears of spreading coronavirus
articles.description: From Bangkok to Beijing, the demand for face masks as a precaution against the coronavirus is intense – and manufactures cannot keep up with demand.
